intro: Stebbinsia umbrella, commonly known as the umbrella plant, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the genus Stebbinsia in the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as smartweeds. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, umbrella-like arrangement of small, white or pink flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically alternate, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Stebbinsia umbrella is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native habitat.
